video.title: Django REST Framework Course – Build Web APIs with Python
video.description:
Django REST Framework is a powerful and flexible toolkit for building Web APIs. In this course for beginner you will learn how to use Python and the Django REST Framework (DRF) to build a web API.

✏️ Course from Bobby Stearman. Check out @DidCoding 

💻Code: https://github.com/bobby-didcoding/drf_course

Other Resources:
https://www.python.org/
https://www.djangoproject.com/
https://www.django-rest-framework.org/
https://httpie.io/
https://curl.se/
https://www.docker.com/

⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:00:29) Module 1: Clone the code and set up our system
⌨️ (0:15:01) Module 2: Add settings and URL configurations
⌨️ (0:25:02) Module 3: Create first API endpoint
⌨️ (0:44:46) Module 4: Write unit tests
⌨️ (0:51:56) Module 5: Create endpoints with authentication
⌨️ (1:01:52) Module 6: Create item and order models and serializers
⌨️ (1:08:54) Module 7: Code viewsets and routers
⌨️ (1:14:30) Module 8: Write final unit tests

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Nattira Maneerat
👾 Heather Wcislo
👾 Serhiy Kalinets
👾 Erdeniz Unvan
👾 Justin Hual
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 Otis Morgan

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Sahil Singhai
topLevelComment.text:
ALLOWED_HOSTS = os.environ.get("DJANGO_ALLOWED_HOSTS").split(" ")
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'split
Module -2 while I am trying to make migrations I am getting this error. Can anybody help me this ?

replies.author: Sahil Singhai
replies.text: I have change the settings ALLOWED_HOSTS to ALLOWED_HOSTS = os.environ.get('DJANGO_ALLOWED_HOSTS', ' ' ).split(" ") and it help me to migrate.

topLevelComment.author: Inacio Paiva
topLevelComment.text:
I'm having problems with docker. Could someone help me?

Successfully tagged djangoapi_app:latest
Creating djangoapi_app_1 ... done
Creating djangoapi_api_1 ... error

ERROR: for djangoapi_api_1  Cannot start service api: failed to create shim task: OCI runtime create failed: runc create failed: unable to start container process: exec: "/code/docker/entrypoints/entrypoint.sh": permission denied: unknown

ERROR: for api  Cannot start service api: failed to create shim task: OCI runtime create failed: runc create failed: unable to start container process: exec: "/code/docker/entrypoints/entrypoint.sh": permission denied: unknown
ERROR: Encountered errors while bringing up the project.

replies.author: Arnaldo Paredes
replies.text: Just apply "chmod +x backend/docker/entrypoints/entrypoint.sh" in any terminal and run docker-compose's command

topLevelComment.author: Ameet Yadav
topLevelComment.text:
In Module 3 I am  getting error in container API(drf_course_api_1) logs as
 exec /code/docker/entrypoints/entrypoint.sh: no such file or directory. Does anyone knows the solution?

replies.author: HM24
replies.text: @Ira thank you!

replies.author: Ameet Yadav
replies.text: @Oluwatosin Theophilus yes

replies.author: Oluwatosin Theophilus
replies.text: @Ameet Yadav Hi were you able to make a post request?

replies.author: Ameet Yadav
replies.text: @Ira thank you so much it is working

replies.author: Ira
replies.text:
In the Dockerfile remove the contents in ENTRYPOINT.    ENTRYPOINT[ ]
Then rebuild and see if containers are running correctly.  This fixed my issue.

topLevelComment.author: trippyboy
topLevelComment.text:
Hey @DidCoding, sorry to be all geeky but I am getting this error while running docker,

ERROR: for drf_course_api_1  Cannot start service api: failed to create shim task: OCI runtime create failed: runc create failed: unable to start container process: exec: "/code/docker/entrypoints/entrypoint.sh": permission denied: unknown

I tried sudo with docker-compose but no change, also I have read online that there is something specific with shell scripts in linux but am not able to solve it, can you help?

replies.author: Oluwatosin Theophilus
replies.text:
Does anyone know why I am getting this when I try to make a post request in Docker - 

http: error: ConnectionError: HTTPConnectionPool(host='api', port=8000): Max retries exceeded with url: /contact/ (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7fe6d7143130>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno -2] Name or service not known')) while doing a POST request to URL: http://api:8000/contact/

replies.author: Ira
replies.text:
@Oluwatosin Theophilus In the Dockerfile remove the contents in ENTRYPOINT.    ENTRYPOINT[ ]
Then rebuild and see if containers are running correctly.  This fixed my issue.

replies.author: trippyboy
replies.text:
first of all the command is wrong, logs subcommand is used to get the logs only it has nothing to do with the exec command.
Exec command is: docker container exec container_id/name your_command_here.
Then secondly, I am not sure I am not on my computer, but if I remember correctly, the code folder isn't there! When you clone the repo[ make sure you clone the right branch ], the docker folder is in the first directory level, go inside that folder and run the pwd command you'll get the correct path of the file/folder.

replies.author: Oluwatosin Theophilus
trippyboy
replies.text:
@Oluwatosin Theophilus hmm, interesting!
You can use docker container logs container_id/container_name to see the stack trace and error message.
